poem:
**Notes to Quintana**

In the margins of motherhood,  
she penned the threats—  
pools like fathomless dreams,  
wires humming songs of danger,  
lye whispering beneath  
the quiet sink.  
Each note an anchor,  
each fear a testament  
to the tremulous art of letting go—  
where love is the text  
and loss,  
the silent footnote.
